questions.a: The study of how DNA affects evolution
questions.b: The Study of tax law as it applies to monkeys
questions.d: The study of reproduction in mammals
questions.e: The grouping biological organisms according to shared characteristics
questions.amp: The word comes from the ancient Greek for 'arrangement' (taxis) and 'naming' (nomia).

questions.q: Modern biology regards ___ as the fundamental unit of heredity.
questions.amp: Genes transmit the fundamental genetic information of life forms.

questions.q: In modern biology, the fundamental engine driving the creation of new species is?
questions.amp: The study of evolution is concerned with the origin and descent of species, and their change over time
Cells transcribe a DNA gene into an RNA version of the gene; ribosomes then translate the RNA into a protein, which is a sequence of amino acids.
